p: Severe and fatal MPV disease can occur among immunocompromised individuals, including solid organ and stem cell transplant recipients, HIV-infected persons, and chemotherapy patients [ 268â€“ 275]. MPV is associated with morbidity and mortality in adults with hematologic malignancies and stem cell transplant; [ 270, 276] MPV was detected in bronchoalveolar lavage specimens from 5/163 (3 %) episodes of acute respiratory infection in stem cell transplant recipients, and four died [ 270]. HIV-positive South African children with MPV were significantly more likely to receive a diagnosis of pneumonia and experience longer hospitalization, lower mean oxygen saturation, and bacteremia; further, HIV-positive children were fivefold more likely to be infected with MPV than HIV-negative children [ 242].
